intro: Lastreopsis manongarivensis, commonly known as the Manongarivensis rockselva, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to nutrient-poor soils. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical research. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
